conclusion: Analyze forces on object A and deformation of springs B and C.
Object A is at rest initially with mass m = 2 kg and spring constant of spring B is k1 = 200 N/m.
Spring C is initially not deformed, and its right endpoint is at position a.
Gravitational force on A is Fg = mg = 19.6 N.
Tension force of spring B on A is FB = k1 x1.
For equilibrium, FB = Fg, so 200 x1 = 19.6, thus x1 = 0.098 m.
Right endpoint of spring C is pulled to position b, ab = 0.6 m.
Deformation of spring C is x2 = 0.6 m.
Force exerted by spring C is FC = k2 x2.
For equilibrium, FC = FB, so k2 x2 = k1 x1, thus k2 = 32.67 N/m.
Height that object A rises is x1 = 0.098 m.
Final answer: Height A rises is 0.098 m, stiffness coefficient k2 is 32.67 N/m.
